original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields drop following US Fed rate cut, rupee stronger
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s secondary market bond yields dropped following the US Federal Reserve rate cut announcement, dealers said, while the rupee appreciated to 301.90/302.00 against the dollar.
Among the actively traded bonds, a bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was seen trading lower at 9.50/54 percent from the previous closing 9.55/60 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.03.2031 was quoted at 10.00/02 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.35/45 percent, from 10.40/49 percent.

The telegraphic transfer rates for the American dollar was 298.5000 buying, 305.5000 selling; the British pound was 405.7748 buying, and 417.1366 selling, and the euro was 350.6062 buying, 361.9694 selling.
The Colombo Stocks Exchange was trading in green; The ASPI was up 0.63 percent, or 131.18 points, at 20,906; the S&P SL20 was down 0.82 percent, or 48.29 points, at 5,951.(Colombo/Sep18/2025).
